recipes.description: A slight modification of one Ken Forkish's ("Flour Water Salt Yeast") Pure Levain recipes. Here's a link to Ken's UTube videos
recipes.note:
Shape, proof and bake similar to the Overnight White Bread recipe. If you really want to get a jump on it, feed your levain with 50g each flour and water two days before baking, then refrigerate it overnight.
 
The Day Before
  • 9:00AM: Feed levain
  • 7:00PM: Begin mixing the dough
  • 8:30PM: Last fold completed
    • Baking Day
  • 11:00AM: Divide bread into baskets
  • 12:15PM: Bake bread
recipes.title: Overnight Levain White Bread

recipes.note:
The AmazingRibs website is a great resource. This recipe takes a week for the cure, then a couple hours smoking, but it's really pretty easy. Remember to scale up the ingredients to match the size of your pork belly slab.
Allspice is one of the few additions that stands up to the salt and pepper in the base recipe. I've had great results - the taste makes it's way into the meat (unlike nearly everything else, which just sits on the surface), but I like Allspice!

recipes.note:
The ingredients list as written represents the amount one person would eat in a single (large) meal. Unless you're eating alone, you'll need to do some math!

Rice flour is a secret weapon. When used to keep the pasta noodles from sticking to one another, pasta may remain at room temperature, covered with a dry towel, for up to a half day.

Using a bench scraper to fold the egg-flour mixture into dough keeps the board clean and reduces waste to almost zero.

recipes.description: I did the research: Foodnetwork host David Lebovitz, a Jewish boy living in Paris, had the best Carnitas recipe. I've modified the recipe slightly, and it continues to evolve.
recipes.note:
The roasting pan is the most important piece of equipment (the only piece of equipment) in this recipe.  It must be big enough to contain all the pork pieces, spread out in a single layer, but not so big that a gallon of water is required to bring the liquid level up high enough to properly braise the pieces.  I use a 
Le Creuset 5-1/4 quart cast iron roaster, roughly 10"x13"x3", and usually just over 5lbs of pork.  It's perfect for this much meat.

recipes.description:
Porchetta is traditionally a roasted whole, de-boned suckling pig; this ain't that. ;-)
I compiled the ingredients list from a number of sources, but I followed Alabama Chef Haller Magee's cooking instructions.
My mother-in-law told my wife this was the best meal she had in her entire life!
recipes.note:
Serves at least twelve. This dish is great with grilled bread, mustards, and pickles. Although I cook potatoes in the roasting pan (it's unbelievable what pork fat does to potatoes over a few hours), it can also be served with polenta or other vegetables.
Note: the interior temperature should be no less than 140F, but don't worry if it exceeds 180F: the goal is to cook the belly correctly, and that takes six hours.
recipes.title: Porchetta
